newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Creditanstalt up as govt sale nears.
newsitem.headline: Creditanstalt up as govt sale nears.

text.p: Shares in Creditanstalt Bankverein were trading 0.7 percent higher in an otherwise limp Vienna market on Tuesday as investors sensed the bank's long awaited privatisation neared.
Creditanstalt preferred shares were 3.5 schillings up at 514.5 at 1012 GMT on volume of 11,209 lots. Ordinary shares stood at 719 schillings, 3.5 up, on volume of 719.
"The government's determination to sell its stake has given the stock some impetus," said a trader.

Austrian Finance Minister Viktor Klima has said bids for the state's 70 percent of Creditanstalt ordinary shares must be in by November 15. He has insisted that the sale of the country's flagship bank will be well underway by the end of the year.
